title: Anyone not able to log in? Possible issue with Mediacom
body: So my isp (Mediacom) was doing maintenance  last night. When i go to log in today it wont let me at all. I have other friends here in the Springfield MO area  with Mediacom that are having the same problem. Any info would be appreciated.

replies.body:
Hey all,

We're currently looking into this issue, but we need your help! Can you guys run a trace route and paste the results on this board? These steps will show you how:

- Press the Windows Key + R to open the Terminal
- Type cmd and press Ok. A black window with white letters should appear
- Copy and paste this line into the command prompt. You must paste by Right Clicking and selecting 'paste'. Ctrl+V will NOT work:  

> (tracert lq.na2.lol.riotgames.com) > "%USERPROFILE%\desktop\Tracert.txt"

- Press enter. This process can take up to 5 minutes
- Navigate to your desktop and open the file labeled 'Tracert.txt' 
- Copy and paste the results to this post

**NOTE: Make sure to run this trace route when you're not able to log in. Otherwise, it will not be useful.**

Thanks!
Would be nice if someone from riot would look at this thread

You guys, please chill out with the hate. Does nothing to solve the problem. Yes, it is frustrating that this is happening. Mediacom is notorious for having horrible customer service. They will flat out deny there is a problem in the first place until the tech comes out and finds out what is going on. 

With call centers they probably memo the account but don't send that along. Riot has been nothing but upfront here in this thread in collecting and providing information. The whole situation isn't riots fault here but they are trying to help. 

I have contacted mediacom 3 times since this has started and the first 2 times I got the run around and they said there wasn't a problem. They denied adding ipv6 addresses to the lines. The 3rd time I called they finally admitted there was known issue. I GAVE THEM the email and nothing has come of it.

This is a difficult issue to troubleshoot because it's not effecting even all of mediacom customers. That is why riot is trying to get someone with their engineering department. So please be civil and act like adults here. If you are really that upset then get ahold of mediacom. Get with someone with their engineering department and stay on the line while they email them.

Network techs here are always working. We're still trying to reach out to Mediacom but have as yet had no response from them. Like I said, if anybody can get an engineer on the line from that company please have them email peering@riotgames.com and it'll go straight to the folks who are working on this.

> [{quoted}](name=Korensky,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=QJgom6db,comment-id=0094,timestamp=2016-03-26T01:29:10.484+0000)
>
> Network techs here are always working. We're still trying to reach out to Mediacom but have as yet had no response from them. Like I said, if anybody can get an engineer on the line from that company please have them email peering@riotgames.com and it'll go straight to the folks who are working on this.

What a load of garbage. You're trying to tell me that you've been calling Mediacom for the 2+ weeks this has been going on but they won't answer your calls? Cmon man, at least pretend like you're tyring

replies.poster: I f i s t I
replies.body: I feel the same way. There are people in this thread that have gotten in contact with  Mediacom (so they say), and that Mediacom is waiting for Riot to respond. But then Riot says the same thing? Doesn't make any sense. Somebody isn't trying. And I have a feeling I know who it is. All I want is the game to be played. No big deal XD

replies.poster: I f i s t I
replies.body: It's been 11 days now. This is starting to get fucking ridiculous.
yep been two weeks for me

I'm glad you were having a different issue than us and were able to fix it. But for us, it's been 2 weeks. We started using VPNs because, again, for us, it's a routing issue. For those of us that it wasn't and you helped, great, thank you, but please don't act high and mighty because the rest of us still want to play a game we love that's supposed to be free, but yanno, for free.

people have been trying vpns, chill

replies.poster: I f i s t I
replies.body: Dude, were getting the "were trying to contact 'said party' and were waiting for a response", when a lot of Summoners here have been getting in contact with both parties. This is a bunch of bullshit and everyone knows it. This isn't "trying" to me.

> [{quoted}](name=CBD Fister,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=QJgom6db,comment-id=008e000100000001,timestamp=2016-03-26T04:05:56.579+0000)
>
> Dude, were getting the "were trying to contact 'said party' and were waiting for a response", when a lot of Summoners here have been getting in contact with both parties. This is a bunch of bullshit and everyone knows it. This isn't "trying" to me.

Well mediacom is just giving the number for their customer service line. Not the network engineering department. It really has nothing to do with riot. Riot didnt change anything, it was mediacom. Mediacom added ipv6 and when they did that update they messed something up with it. Riot needs specific data from mediacom and their engineering department.

> [{quoted}](name=Mat Locke,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=QJgom6db,comment-id=008e0001000000010000,timestamp=2016-03-26T04:46:56.926+0000)
>
> Well mediacom is just giving the number for their customer service line. Not the network engineering department. It really has nothing to do with riot. Riot didnt change anything, it was mediacom. Mediacom added ipv6 and when they did that update they messed something up with it. Riot needs specific data from mediacom and their engineering department.

This is also a lie, I talked to a technician at Mediacom who had already spoken to 5+ other people from my area with the same problem.

He informed me that YES, Mediacom's recent IPv6 update screwed something up, and MEdiacom has contacted Riot to get info from THEM to fix the issue, and Riot won't work with them.

It doesn't matter who is MORE to blame, Riot is guilty, Mediacom is guilty. BOTH of these multi-million dollar companies are taking a big SH*T on their customers and NEITHER give a rat's a$$ about us.
Stop blaming one or the other, hold them both accountable like an objective thinker, not some sheep fanboy who can't admit his/her GOD AND SAVIOR is flawed.

One thing for the lying Riot reps who are coming here and lying to our faces over and over, when I have gotten NAMES from Mediacom and some of them are the same people I hear from other people. so Don't even try to claim it was someone else.

We may not be able to choose something else besides mediacom, but we CAN play DOTA or Smite, or Heroes... so I guess you guys just don't care if tens of thousands of customers move to a competitor?

I'm practicing other MOBAs right now, because I actually boycott companies that treat me like trash.

I might not get my money back, which normally would happen with a physical product, I would literally sue if this were the case, but I will make sure Riot never see's a dime from me again.

So I just got off the phone with mediacom, they say there is nothing they can do about this till you, riot, contact them and get paired up with them. THey are giving us the people the run around. The lady I spoke with this morning, said to just call them at the number I use. so Riot, here is that number, 18556334226 get in touch with them, get th is peering taking care of, because this is getting stupid. I need....NEEED to kill some adcs and supports. lol. get us back to bitch at each other instead of you. lol Hope this helps. I also gave them the email you gave us to give them. One of both sides need to stop dragging behind.

I have set up to have a callback with Mediacom T2. I have noted about peering@riotgames.com and I'm going to take it as high as I can I even went as far as making the write it down and asked for a way to get to their engineering department. Its almost embarrassing calling because I can't log into a videogame and explaining that to each person but what can I say...I like to do battle on the Rift and everybody has a hobby. 

Once I hear back if my situation changes and I am able to log in again I will post here and let you guys know what steps I took.
Able to log in now.  Still borked though.  Once loading screen for a game tries to start, it just sits at a black screen and it says after about a minute "Unable Connect to server" error.
Now we're back at the weekend, when network techs for Riot probably do not work, and we'll still be without League, stuck in purgatory between two terrible, terrible support divisions.
Anybody in Springfield able to log in yet? I can't take it anymore it feels like the apocalypse right now.
Thanks for the info everybody! I've shared all of the info posted with the network engineers. I'll post an update when I receive one!

Is the the same issue/will be fixed with the issue in Oklahoma and Texas with Cable One? I know some people it has started working but some of us are still 10-11 days of not being able to log on without using a vpn.

springfield missouri. unable to login as well. worked fine last night around 730pm. earliest known time I wasnt able to login was 700am today. login authentication is successful but unable to make it past pvp.net. Also got mediacom.

same here, mediacom basically said o well you can log through a vpn so theres no problem and left it at that. and it happened as clubs went live for me. havn't really been keeping up with their maintenance but out here i constantly have spurts where my service will go out for like 30 seconds to a minute then come back on. work for a few hours then do it again. mediacom tells me they cant do anything about it because it never happens when im on the phone with a tech who can actually witness the problem from their end. and yeah no other cable service in this area to switch too.

> [{quoted}](name=Zelis,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=QJgom6db,comment-id=000c,timestamp=2016-03-17T00:13:32.246+0000)

> same here, mediacom basically said o well you can log through a vpn so theres no problem and left it at that. and it happened as clubs went live for me. havn't really been keeping up with their maintenance but out here i constantly have spurts where my service will go out for like 30 seconds to a minute then come back on. work for a few hours then do it again. mediacom tells me they cant do anything about it because it never happens when im on the phone with a tech who can actually witness the problem from their end. and yeah no other cable service in this area to switch too.

I find that to be a load of bs. They have loggs they can look at for each one line. They can try and pin point it from that. I had problems for like 2 months strait and they finally narrowed it down to a couple different switches they replaced and then my connection was stable. I also got a permanent discount for having the problems for so long

I've had this issue for close to a year and have called them about it almost once a month

Mediacom are all perfect little snowflakes that do no wrong. My family was out of internet, phone, and cable for two weeks and we kept putting work orders in to get it fixed. They had said that they sent techs out to check the problem, well they did check, but at one end and didn't do any further investigation. We ended up getting a manager out here to fix it. Turns out a literal cable was severely damaged.

> [{quoted}](name=Shingdigg,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=QJgom6db,comment-id=000c000000000000,timestamp=2016-03-20T01:02:57.054+0000)
>
> Mediacom are all perfect little snowflakes that do no wrong. My family was out of internet, phone, and cable for two weeks and we kept putting work orders in to get it fixed. They had said that they sent techs out to check the problem, well they did check, but at one end and didn't do any further investigation. We ended up getting a manager out here to fix it. Turns out a literal cable was severely damaged.

I totally get that mediacom is shit and has terrible customer service and you're not the first I've heard this type of story from, but this time, just this time, it is ACTUALLY Riot's fault in a way. It's most likely a routing error, which just means that riot is not connecting to mediacom (in the simplest terms possible.) It's likely because Mediacom just did a huge system update from IPv4 to IPv6. Unless mediacom is intentionally "blocking them out" (which would be silly, considering they would lose a good mass of people that play the game to other net companies, even the crappier ones are better if you can't do what you want on the "good" one), Riot is the one that has to fix it, because they basically have to say that their servers can connect to Mediacom's servers in order to them to connect. Again, this is just as I understand it from literally everything I've researched (and I've had about..... 5 days to do so at this point) and my own general knowledge, broken down into common terms as much as possible, so if that doesn't make sense I apologize.

We all get that Mediacom is shit, but sometimes Riot is, too. Don't put them on a pedestal just because they're better than Mediacom. I can name a lot of things better than shit.
Springfield, MO also reporting in, Can't log in either.
Springfield, MO, reporting in.  Can't log in yo.

I am having the same issue, springfield, mo, mediacom.... For all the haters, I can tell you... I used to be a tech for mediacom... anything those guys tell you about this issue they are surely making up for conversation. stuff like this is way above them. some of them might catch snipets here and there and make stuff up based on that but I assure you the techs are not kept up on what is going on between mediacom and Riot... It is common practice to tell the customer whatever they want to hear at the time in order to make the techs experience easier, instead of dealing with an angry cutomer demanding answers that they dont have.

Instead of waisting your time flaming Riot why dont you be useful in solving the problem and submit the logs they requested in a tech support ticket so they can use the info you help your whiny asses.

UPDATE: I have played a few games now, and everything seems fine. In truth my ping is so nice right now. I normaly pull a high 40 to low 50 and right now im pulling around 25. So back to gaming. Have fun everyone
Well I am online, which is awesome. I am about to start a aram game to give it the final test run before I hope into a norm game then ranked. I will fill everyone in on what happens.
Wait JK game's not loading.
Yeah i was so happy i was able to log in. Champ select and everything worked after that it wouldn't let me connect to the servers... again.

Mediacom has finally replied to riot as of one of their support sites. They have no eta with it. Please be patient. In the meantime try WTFAST for a vpn. You get a 2 week free trial and I was getting a steady 28 ping.
Hey y'all just update it says Mediacom and riot have contacted each other.  Just trying to confirm through a rioter here if this is true or more run around

Alright. This is literally the last thing I'm doing because I'm so beyond done. I called them and they said "You, as the customer, need to find out the ports they need opened and call back and give us the ports and we'll open them."

So I need a 2 to 4 digit port number to give them, Riot. OR you could call them at 1-888-769-1674 and ask for tech support and do it your damned self. It should not be up to us as the players to do your grunt work, TBH. Either way, just be the bigger company and get this fixed, because there's really no other internet we can actually play games on in this city without data caps or high ping, and I will not pay for a VPN to play your free game.

Le sigh. so a little bit of respect lost today.

So I put in a ticket to riot, I called mediacom. Today I get this email back from riot. this cracks me up so hard.

Frost Ace	
Frost Ace (Riot Games Player Support)
Mar 25, 12:02

Hi there Whogz!

I understand that you're having some troubles with logging into your account. Unfortunately, we're unable to call Mediacom, but we can look into this login issue for you. Would you mind providing us a screenshot of what you are seeing? You can obtain a screenshot out-of-game through the following steps:

Press Print Screen

Open MS Paint

Paste the screenshot onto MS Paint

Save it as a .jpg or .png file.

While in-game, however, you simply just need to:

Press F12

Locate the screenshot inside C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Screenshots

I look forward to your next message. If you need anything else, don't hesitate to get in touch. We are at your service 24/7!

Frost Ace
Player Support Specialist
The Tidecaller's Voice

The best part of this, isnt that they cant help me, its that they "We are unable to call Mediacom"

so what im seeing here is you guys wont call mediacom to move things along. I dont see this as going over well in general. Mediacom says the same thing, they cant contact Riot. So who is lieing, and who is bullshiting their way to losing customers? 

Riot, please, just call the isp, help us move along, because all they tell us to do, is give you the phone number and have you call them. Be the better company and help your player base here in Springfield, mo get back to the game we all love and play.

This is sad and stupid. Both your guys companys are at fault here now. I dont care where it started, but your both ating like 2nd graders not willing to talk to each other. 

le sigh. Back to not playing league....
plz

I just spoke to someone from Mediacom, he told me he has had several other calls from my area call about this and that Riot is refusing to allow Mediacom to troubleshoot their servers.

I can't imagine why he would lie about this, because it could cost him his job. This sounds like a bunch of communication problems, Riot is the one losing money so they should figure out what is not being done to end this mess.

I knew when Riot was purchased this kind of thing would start happening...

so i've been dealing with this same issue for about 11days and i've done srsly everytihng its your router ports being closed. open the ports and play the game. blame mediacom for effecting your router
